basics.name: Samuel Tyler
basics.label: Full-stack Web Application Developer
basics.summary: Standards-compliant Web application programmer, utilizing HTML, CSS, Javascript (ES16), Ruby on Rails, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Vue.js, web components, Angular, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, NoSQL, and many other modern technologies. Leveraging the power of automated testing frameworks for accuracy and correctness.

highlights: Developed a central API shared by clients and microservices to store and distribute highly structured data.
Created a Kubernetes cluster for managing dozens of microservices.
Created an online document viewer so users can explore how the platform analyzed their documents.
Created an integrated inventory retrieval system using several microservices for use by warehouse workers.
On the product team that helped launch Bulq.com
Updated and maintained a large codebase with 20 other developers, written in Ruby on Rails, for managing large inventories
Created several frontend applications in Vue.js, React, and Angular.
work.summary: Full-stack developer, utilizing Ruby on Rails, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Javascript (ES16), gulp, grunt, Angular, elasticsearch, kibana, Vue.js.

highlights: Created and maintained several applications used in the medical, social, military, and disaster-relief fields.
Lead a small team of 4 to 6 developers using agile methodologies.
work.summary: I am a Ruby on Rails developer, specializing in client-side technologies and social network analysis.

work.company: University of North Carolina at Greensboro
highlights: Created and maintained several applications used in the medical, social, military, and disaster-relief fields.
Lead a small team of 4 to 6 developers using agile methodologies.
work.summary: I am a Ruby on Rails developer, specializing in client-side technologies and social network analysis.

work.company: University of North Carolina at Greensboro
highlights: Secretary of UNCG chapter of the Association for Computing Machinery for 2 years.
Student worker for 5 years (see work history).
Awarded a research assistantship for 2 years to work on GISpatialNet. https://sourceforge.net/projects/spatialnet/
work.summary: Design and maintain web sites for the School of Arts and Sciences, the largest school at UNCG, which is comprised of 27 departments.

highlights: Worked with the Gtk-Perl community to resolve bugs and beta test new features. (in 2003)
Developed a GUI framework for configuration files. https://sourceforge.net/projects/puniconf/
Developed a GUI for Perl module management, in WxPerl, called WxCPAN. https://sourceforge.net/projects/wxcpan/
Mentoring under the BizziQuest organization on GitHub since 2020. https://github.com/BizziQuest
Developing an open source blog platform in svelte. https://github.com/skamansam/skamansam.github.io
Developing a full-features list management application for use as a platform for other types of applications. https://github.com/BizziQuest/QuestListsFB
Worked with a team of research assistants to implement a social network algorithm and viewer, GISpatialNet. https://sourceforge.net/projects/spatialnet/
work.summary: I have been continuously developing and contributing to open source software since 2003.

education.institution: University of North Carolina at Greensboro
